item.title: Don't count . . . quantify!
item.description:
Salmon —Don't count . . . quantify!

Overview

Salmon is a tool for quantifying the expression of transcripts using RNA-seq data. Salmon uses new algorithms (specifically, coupling the concept of quasi-mapping with a two-phase inference procedure) to provide accurate expression estimates

item.title: tset2
item.description: To demonstrate the advantage of integrating different data types, we benchmarked EMOGI against methods that use only one type of data—either multiomics features or the network topology. We chose a random forest classifier trained on all multiomics features from the 16 cancer types as a feature-only baseline. We chose the PageRank36 and DeepWalk30 as network-only baselines, two pop- ular algorithms that use only the network topology—in this case the PPI network—for either node prioritization or latent represen- tation learning of the network’s nodes.
